member.name: P:Independentsoft.Msg.Message.Priority
member.summary: Contains the relative priority of a message.
member.remarks: This property and the property should not be confused. Importance indicates a value to users, while priority indicates the order or speed at which the message should be sent by the messaging system software. Higher priority usually indicates a higher cost. Higher importance usually is associated with a different display by the user interface.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Msg.Message.MessageFlags
member.summary: Contains a bitmask of flags that indicate the origin and current state of a message.
member.remarks: This property is a nontransmittable message property exposed at both the sending and receiving ends of a transmission, with different values depending upon the client application or store provider involved. This property is initialized by the client or message store provider when a message is created and saved for the first time and then updated periodically by the message store provider, a transport provider, and the MAPI spooler as the message is processed and its state changes. This property exists on a message both before and after submission, and on all copies of the received message. Although it is not a recipient property, it is exposed differently to each recipient according to whether it has been read or modified by that recipient.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag
member.summary: Contains a value that indicates the origin and current state of a message.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.Associated
member.summary: The message is an associated message of a folder. The client or provider has read-only access to this flag. The Read flag is ignored for associated messages, which do not retain a read/unread state.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.FromMe
member.summary: The messaging user sending was the messaging user receiving the message. This flag is meant to be set by the transport provider.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.HasAttachment
member.summary: The message has at least one attachment. The client has read-only access to this flag.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.NonReadReportPending
member.summary: A nonread report needs to be sent for the message. The client or provider has read-only access to this flag.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.OriginInternet
member.summary: The incoming message arrived over the Internet. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway cannot consider trusted. The client should display an appropriate message to the user. Transport providers set this flag; the client has read-only access.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.OriginMiscExternal
member.summary: The incoming message arrived over an external link other than X.400 or the Internet. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway cannot consider trusted. The client should display an appropriate message to the user. Transport providers set this flag; the client has read-only access.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.OriginX400
member.summary: The incoming message arrived over an X.400 link. It originated either outside the organization or from a source the gateway cannot consider trusted. The client should display an appropriate message to the user. Transport providers set this flag; the client has read-only access.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.Read
member.summary: The message is marked as having been read. This flag is ignored if the Associated flag is set.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.Resend
member.summary: The message includes a request for a resend operation with a non-delivery report.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.ReadReportPending
member.summary: A read report needs to be sent for the message. The client or provider has read-only access to this flag.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.Submit
member.summary: The message is marked for sending. Message store providers set this flag; the client has read-only access.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.Unmodified
member.summary: The outgoing message has not been modified since the first time that it was saved; the incoming message has not been modified since it was delivered.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.MessageFlag.Unsent
member.summary: The message is still being composed. It is saved, but has not been sent. Typically, this flag is cleared after the message is sent.

member.summary: The message store supports categorized views of tables.

member.summary: The message store supports creation of new messages.

member.summary: Entry identifiers for the objects in the message store are unique, that is, never reused during the life of the store.

member.summary: The message store supports HTML messages, stored in the property.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.ItemProc
member.summary: In a wrapped PST store, indicates that when a new message arrives at the store, the store does rules and spam filter processing on the message separately.

member.summary: This flag is reserved and should not be used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.Modify
member.summary: The message store supports modification of its existing messages.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.MultiValueProperties
member.summary: The message store supports multivalued properties, guarantees the stability of value order in a multivalued property throughout a save operation, and supports instantiation of multivalued properties in tables.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.Notify
member.summary: The message store supports notifications.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.Ole
member.summary: The message store supports OLE attachments.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.PublicFolders
member.summary: The folders in this store are public (multi-user), not private (possibly multi-instance but not multi-user).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.Pusher
member.summary: The MAPI Protocol Handler will not crawl the store, and the store is responsible to push any changes through notifications to the indexer to have messages indexed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.ReadOnly
member.summary: All interfaces for the message store have a read-only access level.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Msg.StoreSupportMask.Restrictions
member.summary: The message store supports restrictions.
